Reviews.Title: “An Ok Hotel”
Reviews.Author: WaleedMadanat
Reviews.Content: The staff don't care enough to hold the door for you even if they were standing beside it, or even probably had just went through it and saw you coming. The room was OK but it had a slight cigarettes smell to it. and one of the windows needed maintenance it wasn't properly closed and you could hear the traffic outside. The good thing about the hotel was its location, very close to the Financial Center metro station and plenty of coffee and food places around.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: katayounm
Reviews.Content: the location was very good, near duabi mall and near metro station. the rooms were ok and clean, the breakfast again ok. though compared to the the prices everything was very good. even in the high season the prices (compared to dubai prices, mind) was in the average range and so a big plus. the staff and the service were, ummmm, were not the best. the desk staff were really pretty unfriendly and i didn't see them smile or say good morning once but then maybe they were thinking "hah you are not paying us enough!!" :) and the rooms got cleaned at the strangest hours and alot of time we'd be back around 4 or 5 and sill the rooms weren't cleaned. overall, ok everything, good price and good location

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: JGLKI
Reviews.Content: The building is in a good location on the seafront side of Sheikh Zayd road, located only a 2-minute walk to the Finance District Metro station on the red line. On the ground floor of the building is a very popular Tim Hortons Cafe which is ideal for free wi-fi and breakfast and located next to Tim Hortons is a much quieter Starbucks. There are lots of Restaurants and Cafe's within walking distance. The Suites are clean akthough approaching a bit tired but our one-bed studio appartment was more than adequate for our needs and I would stay here again if I was after reasonably priced accomodation in Dubai rather than an hotel holiday complex.

Reviews.Title: “A place to stay”
Reviews.Author: ThePlodder
Reviews.Content: I stayed a week in number One Tower partly due to my prefered locations in Sheik Zayed Road having some odd upward pricing due to local events on that week. At least the No1 Tower maintained a steady and reasonably cheap option on the lead up to booking so I gave it a try despite some less than perfect reviews. The location is almost adjacent the Financial Centre metro station on the seaward side of Sheik Zayed road and is very convienent for the Dubai mall, Burj Khalifa even for those who like to walk. The accomodation is apartments although there is a reasonable if smallish 24 hour lobby and reception area at the side with a small cafe which didn't appear to be open all night and although I didn't use it I don't believe alcoholic drinks were available here. Check in was quick and didn't even require my booking credit card presenting which speeded things up at a late hour. As usual as I find in Dubai there was very little happiness or welcome from the counter staff. The lift access to the rooms was round the corner in the lobby from the reception meaning you come come and go without being in the full glare off the reception although some may see this as a security issue as there was free access to the lifts. I booked a larger panoramic view apartment which occupies the corner of the rear of the building and found it to be quite spacious with as advertised a wide view of the seeward vista of Dubai (Jumeirah area and the sea a mile away) although this did include much of the apartment block next door in view. Mainly open plan with a small divider wall for the bed area it had a small kitchenette area in the entrance hallway with a hotplate but annoyingly no microwave. Basic utensils were supplied and a few bowls and plates. The Bathroom had bath and shower and was fitted out in marble effect and was quite good although the drain on the floor backed up when emptying the bath and flooded the floor which didn't drain away too quickly.Towels and minimal washing lotions were supplied daily. The living area consisted of hard leather sofa and chair with coffe table and a 32 inch LCD TV on the wall although this was fixed and couldn't easily be seen from the bed. I did't see any movie channels available and the free channels although varied were often poor quality reception. The bed was surprisingly large and comfortable althugh the sheets had a slight plastickly feel which some may not enjoy. The air conditioniong seems to have one cold setting even though having a thermostat and this made the room too cold at night nearly always meaning that you had to turn it off completely before going to sleep. There was no particular noise from adjacent rooms or any building work nearby and being at the back of the building and high up there was no noise from the busy Sheik Zayed road. I can't comment on the hotel services as I don't use room service or eat in hotels and there are plenty of food outlets (and bars) not too far away. The pool is indoor only and is small and there are no apparent areas wihin the building to get some sunshine although I believe the smaller non panorama rooms may have limited balconies so this isn't a place to relax in the sun for a few days. Overall it's a large no frills (thrills?) apartment not bad for the price and location. The downsides are that it's just not classy, it's a place to stay in rather than enjoy being there and lacks a few touches that other albeit more expensive locations enjoy. I also was not particularly impressed with some staff attitudes and as I've read in another review the desk staff seem to be making comments about you between each other to the point where i was was pointed at by the receptionist who then shared a joke with his colleague after checking out while sat waiting in the lobby for a taxi. As a place to stay given minimal contact with the staff and facilites and you want more than space than a small hotel room (panorama room, unfortunately I can't comment on the standard rooms although they did look much smaller on the fire plan) this may be a good choice. Those wanting a lasting experience may be better suitable elsewhere on Sheik Zayed.

Reviews.Title: “Try elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: miryas
Reviews.Content: I used ti live in Dubai went back to visit friends, I like Sheikh Zayed road so wanted a hotel there. Room was not clean, the bathroom floor flooded everytime I took a shower or emptied the bath. No full length mirrors in bedroom. Room service was slow and when the food finally arrived it was cold. Front office staff were very surly. I only stayed 2 nights then moved to another hotel. Disappointing

Reviews.Title: “So-so”
Reviews.Author: Svetlana P
Reviews.Content: The hotel is OK. We have changed the room with carpet (due to smoke smell) to the one without carpet. The pool is indoor and does not look great. Breakfast is standard.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: hotelexpertise
Reviews.Content: I like to use this hotel on my business trip to Dubai. It is located in middle od Sheihk zayed rd. with good room service and polite staff at all. In building is nice Italian restaurant and Starbucks coffee as well. For me can recomend. Easy, clean, cheap. As always in Dubai expensive internet connection. Kitchennete in room.

Reviews.Title: “Decent”
Reviews.Author: Pra1234
Reviews.Content: Very well located, easy access to the Financial Center metro station and leading shopping malls in Dubai and also in the vicinity of Bruj Kalifa. Room is very large with a comfortable bed, clean. But the same breakfast for every day(i stayed 21 days) with out a single variation. Overall its a very decent place to stay...

Reviews.Title: “Okay”
Reviews.Author: wklau
Reviews.Content: The hotel did not really leave an impression on me in terms of would I recommend it? The GOOD: reliable service from house keeping, it was quiet and it was clean The BAD: reception desk are grumpy, Internet does not work, taxis can be difficult The UGLY: very poor lighting in rooms, friends are quizzed for I.D rooms are slightly depressing. Maybe overall is you get what you pay for???

Reviews.Title: “Cockroach problem!”
Reviews.Author: MrBrutUK
Reviews.Content: Such a shame, as this hotel has been around for a while, but they have a huge insect problem. If you look amongst your room there's evidence of holes covered up in nooks and crannies, the house keepings cleanliness wasn't really upto scratch from day one but i imagined this is what you get from a hotel of this rate. BUT nothing can prepare me from the site of three cockroaches in my kitchen area. The housekeeping gentleman who could hardly speak any english went straight to areas in the wardrobe and under the sink as if it wasn't a suprise occurrence. Having paid two months in advance for our teams of businessmen i wasn't offered a refund on the remainder of my stay and we all vacated from apparent complaints my colleages had had but hadn't mentioned to myself. The cleanliness is poor here. We lost alot of money and the awful experience i would never repeat. It sen d shudders every time i pass that part of the street. STEER CLEAR you can get much better places on the same stretch of Sheikh Zayed Road.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, convenient and amenable!”
Reviews.Author: FullMoonSydney
Reviews.Content: Recently I stayed in Number One Tower Suites in Dubai and found it extremely enjoyable due to the location (right on the metro stop Financial Centre), proximity to the Burj Khalifa and Dubai Mall, friendly service, spaciousness of the rooms and most of all value for money. I will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: mjay72
Reviews.Content: Very good position (in front of metro) walking distance to supermarkets and restaurants. Excellent front desk service, didn't charge us for early check in and they prepare our room within an hour. Clean an conformable rooms. Good experience for all my family. I will stay again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Suite!”
Reviews.Author: VampireMadrid
Reviews.Content: So lovely and quiet place to stay there, I thought it's going to be hard to sleep in front of the Sheikh Zayd Road but I was wrong! Amazing room and services, everything is available and near to the building, you can walk for less than a minute to locate restaurants, coffee shops, and the metro service which is going to be in front you once you go out of the building. Also you'll find after travel agents, pharmacies and supermarkets. Taxes are easy to find 24 hours on that road, it also can be ordered from the reception before you leave the room! Super nice place to stay in there, definitely will book there again in the next trip to Dubai. I just miss one thing in there important to me which is the sport channels :( Found solution by walking to Arabic coffee shop near to the building where they serve Hookah :D

Reviews.Title: “Good long stay comfortable place”
Reviews.Author: PB2201
Reviews.Content: Stayed twice for 10 days each. got a corner room (they gave me same room second time, almost felt like a 2nd home). This corner room was really spacious, i could even do yoga in room. Have kitchennete and fridge, good and prompt laundry service. Didnt try food there other than buffet breakfast as there are so many dining options at sheikh zayad road, just down below and walking. Grocery stores nearby, so you can stock up on food if you want to cook. They dont mind room delivery also from other restaurants nearby. Warning - almost same breakfast menu every day, so for long stay one can get bored. They can make eggs and sandwich to order though without extra charge. Good gym, have pool also but i didnt use it. Only the writing desk in this room wasnt very comfortable, my friend who was in a smaller room, had a better study table. Oh, yes, temp could not be adjusted above a certain number, i froze, i used to be in warmers in month of may-june. TV didnt have any Indian channel and i missed the ipl finals. Most of the staff is Asian and very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel apartment experience”
Reviews.Author: thegreatdane
Reviews.Content: Stayed for about a week in this hotel in an Executive Panorama suite. The location is good and the staff try to provide an okay service. The rate is quite attractive compared to many other places in Dubai, which is a city mainly populated by four and five star hotels and resorts. The breakfast is not very interesting, and the the rooms and facilities seem a little run down. The apartment facilities are nice to have if you like a cup of coffee in your room or travel with small children.

Reviews.Title: “nice and clean”
Reviews.Author: Desert_Rose2007
Reviews.Content: We lived in Number One Tower Suites in dubai for 6 nights . The hotel is clean in general , the lobby is small , the room was ok regarding space ( that’s the standard suite ) there are bigger suites with 2 rooms and a small living rooms , there is a small kitchen with all the basic stuff that you might need but they are not very clean . the breakfast was nice with reasonable varieties, and although there is no egg corner you can ask for any type of egg cooking you like. it has a good location in Shik Zaid road , with so many near by restaurants , The rooms do not have good sound isolation I mean you can sometimes hear the people when they talk out side your room or even if they move stuff in the flour abouve you , its not that annoying but it worth mentioning . The staff were friendly and the room service will provide you with any thing like suing kit or slippers which I found very convenient because there is no carpet on the floor and its so cold to walk on with out a slipper . there is a nice swimming pool and a gym . so in general this hotel was OK .

HotelInfo.Name: Number One Tower Suites
HotelInfo.Address: Sheikh Zayd Road | P.O. Box 31003, Dubai, United Arab Emirates
